Banking System Requirements Document
Version 1.0

FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Account Management
The system shall allow customers to create new checking and savings accounts online.
Account holders must be able to view their transaction history for the past 24 months.
The platform will support automated bill pay scheduling for recurring payments.
Users shall receive SMS notifications for transactions exceeding $500.

Transaction Processing
All transactions must be processed in real-time during business hours.
The system shall support ACH transfers between internal accounts.
Wire transfer functionality must comply with federal banking regulations.
Transaction limits shall be configurable by account type and customer profile.

NON-FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Performance Specifications
The system must handle 50,000 concurrent users during peak hours.
Transaction processing time cannot exceed 3 seconds for standard operations.
Database response time shall be under 100ms for 99% of queries.
System availability must be 99.95% excluding scheduled maintenance windows.

Security Requirements
All data transmission must use TLS 1.3 encryption minimum.
Customer authentication requires multi-factor verification.
System must log all access attempts for audit purposes.
Sensitive data shall be encrypted at rest using FIPS 140-2 Level 3 standards.

COMPLIANCE CONSTRAINTS

The system must comply with SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) regulations.
PCI DSS Level 1 compliance is mandatory for payment card data.
FFIEC guidelines must be followed for all IT operations.
BSA (Bank Secrecy Act) reporting requirements must be automated.

BUSINESS ASSUMPTIONS

Customers have access to smartphones for mobile authentication.
Branch staff will receive 40 hours of training on the new system.
Existing core banking system APIs will remain stable during migration.
Regulatory approval process will take maximum 6 months.

EXCLUSIONS

Cryptocurrency trading functionality is not included.
International wire transfer capabilities are excluded from Phase 1.
AI-powered fraud detection will be implemented in Phase 2.
Integration with investment portfolio management is out of scope.
